title: Downloadable sample CSV templates and dashboard-accessible “How to use this platform” guide

requirements.summary: Add sample CSV templates as static public assets downloadable without backend calls
acceptanceCriteria: The following files exist under a public static path (e.g., frontend/public/assets/samples/) and are served by the frontend without requiring backend calls: trade-import-sample.csv, bank-reconciliation-sample.csv, client-bulk-upload-sample.csv, margin-snapshot-sample.csv
Each CSV file content matches the sample formats previously provided (headers + at least two example rows).
Directly visiting each file URL in the browser downloads/displays the CSV successfully (HTTP 200).

file_operations.description: Create the Trade Import sample CSV as a static asset with the provided header format and at least two example rows so it can be downloaded directly (no backend capability).
Create the Bank Reconciliation sample CSV as a static asset with the provided header format and at least two example rows so it can be downloaded directly (no backend capability).
Create the Client Bulk Upload sample CSV as a static asset with the provided header format and at least two example rows so it can be downloaded directly (no backend capability).
Create the Margin Snapshot sample CSV as a static asset with the provided header format and at least two example rows so it can be downloaded directly (no backend capability).

requirements.summary: Add “Download sample file” links/buttons on each relevant module page pointing to the static CSV assets
acceptanceCriteria: Trade Import page (frontend/src/pages/data-entry/TradeImportPage.tsx) includes a clearly labeled download link/button for the Trade Import sample CSV that points to the static asset URL.

Bank Reconciliation page (frontend/src/pages/reconciliation/BankReconciliationPage.tsx) includes a clearly labeled download link/button for the Bank Reconciliation sample CSV that points to the static asset URL.
Client Management page (frontend/src/pages/clients/ClientManagementPage.tsx) includes a clearly labeled download link/button for the Client Bulk Upload sample CSV that points to the static asset URL.
Margin & Collateral page (frontend/src/pages/margin/MarginCollateralPage.tsx) includes a clearly labeled download link/button for the Margin Snapshot sample CSV that points to the static asset URL.
All download links use English user-facing text and do not require any special permissions beyond being logged in (i.e., visible to authenticated users who can view the page).

file_operations.description: Expose a clearly labeled “Download sample file” UI control near the upload area that links to the static asset at frontend/public/assets/samples/trade-import-sample.csv. Use existing shadcn-ui primitives already used on the page (e.g., Card/Button/Tabs) to keep styling consistent. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Expose a clearly labeled “Download sample file” UI control on the page (not permission-gated beyond being logged in) that links to frontend/public/assets/samples/bank-reconciliation-sample.csv. Use existing shadcn-ui primitives already used on the page (e.g., Card/Button). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Expose a clearly labeled “Download sample file” UI control for bulk client upload that links to frontend/public/assets/samples/client-bulk-upload-sample.csv. Place it in a discoverable location (e.g., page header area near primary actions) and keep it visible for authenticated users who can view the page. Use existing shadcn-ui primitives already used on the page (e.g., Button/Card). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Expose a clearly labeled “Download sample file” UI control that links to frontend/public/assets/samples/margin-snapshot-sample.csv, placed near the Margin Snapshots context. Use existing shadcn-ui primitives already used on the page (e.g., Card/Tabs/Button). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a reader-friendly “How to use this platform” guide page and link to it prominently from the dashboard overview
acceptanceCriteria: A new guide view/page exists that presents a structured, reader-friendly “How to use this platform” guide in English with headings and sections suitable for scanning (e.g., Getting Started, Roles & Permissions, Trade Import, Clients, Margin, Reconciliation, Reports, Calendar, Surveillance, Audit Trail, Configuration, Troubleshooting/FAQ).
The guide is reachable from the dashboard (frontend/src/pages/OverviewPage.tsx) via a clearly labeled card/section and button/link (e.g., “How to use this platform”).
Navigation to the guide does not break existing routes and works with the current TanStack Router setup (frontend/src/App.tsx).
The guide content is readable on both desktop and smaller screens (reasonable typography, spacing, and scroll behavior).

file_operations.description: Create a dedicated guide page that renders a structured English “How to use this platform” document with scannable headings/sections (Getting Started, Roles & Permissions, Trade Import, Clients, Margin, Reconciliation, Reports, Calendar, Surveillance, Audit Trail, Configuration, Troubleshooting/FAQ) using existing layout patterns and shadcn-ui primitives (e.g., Card) for consistent typography and spacing. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Register a new TanStack Router route for the guide page (e.g., a path like /how-to-use) and ensure it renders within the existing authenticated DashboardLayout + Outlet route tree without breaking current routes.

Add a prominent “How to use this platform” card/section on the dashboard overview with a clear button/link that navigates to the new guide route. Use existing shadcn-ui primitives already used on the page (Card/Button) for consistent styling and responsive readability. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
